rules: Rule1: If Project Nexus has funding from Venture Capital, then Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule2: If the Live Feed is ready for streaming on the Platform, then the Encoder has a stable connection to the Network.
Rule3: If the Encoder has a stable connection to the Network, then Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule4: If Prototype A is functional on stage with the Presenter, then the Presenter receives a cue from the Director.
Rule5: If the Presenter executes the demo with Prototype A, then Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule6: If the Director gives a visual cue to the Presenter, then when the Presenter receives a cue from the Director, the Presenter executes the demo with Prototype A.
Rule7: Either the Director gives a visual cue to the Presenter or the Director gives a verbal cue to the Presenter.
Rule8: If the Director gives a verbal cue to the Presenter, then when the Presenter receives a cue from the Director, the Presenter executes the demo with Prototype A.
Rule9: If the Engineer confirms readiness of Prototype A, then when Prototype A is functional on stage with the Presenter, Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule10: If the Lead Tech verifies the status of Prototype A, then when Prototype A is functional on stage with the Presenter, Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule11: If the Engineer is present in the booth backstage, then the Engineer confirms readiness of Prototype A.
Rule12: Either the Engineer is present in the booth backstage or the Lead Tech is available onsite at the venue.
Rule13: If the VP is monitoring remotely through the Engineer, then when the Lead Tech is available onsite at the venue, the Lead Tech verifies the status of Prototype A.
Rule14: Either the VP is monitoring remotely through the Engineer or the Advisor is watching the feed of the Lead Tech.
Rule15: If the Advisor is watching the feed of the Lead Tech, then when the Lead Tech is available onsite at the venue, the Lead Tech verifies the status of Prototype A.
Rule16: If the CTO activates the contingency plan for the Team, then the Launch Team uses the backup demo with Prototype B.
Rule17: Either Marketing receives approval for the Demo Script or, if Project Nexus does not have funding from Venture Capital, then the CTO activates the contingency plan for the Team.
Rule18: If the President authorizes the live demonstration for the Division, then when Prototype A passes QA Standards, Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule19: Either the President authorizes the live demonstration for the Division or the QA Head grants clearance for Prototype A.
Rule20: If the QA Head grants clearance for Prototype A, then when Prototype A passes QA Standards, Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
Rule21: If the AV Crew completes setup of the System, then the Live Feed is ready for streaming on the Platform.
Rule22: Either the AV Crew completes setup of the System or the Stage Manager finishes checks of the Equipment.
Rule23: If the Stage Manager finishes checks of the Equipment, then Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
facts: Fact1: Prototype A is functional on stage with the Presenter.
Fact2: Prototype A passes QA Standards.
Fact3: The Launch Team does not use the backup demo with Prototype B.
Fact4: Marketing does not receive approval for the Demo Script.

question: Project Nexus has a successful launch at the Event.
